District 205 has joined forces with Honest Game to ensure that all of our students are academically eligible to play at the NCAA, DI, DII and NAIA levels!

Honest Game takes students’ transcript/test scores and translates it into a College Athletic Report on Eligibility (CARETM). CARETM tracks all the academic requirements and ensures you know what to do before it’s too late. College coaches love the CARETM, because it does all the calculations for them and shows them you have a plan. There’s also a section where parents can consent for teachers to share their CARE™ with college coaches, so you don’t have to ask for permission every time a request comes in. With this new tool, District 205 will ensure our student athletes are ready for the next level!



Watch this 90 second video on Honest Game to see why we've teamed up with them!

Since March 17, 2020, District 205 has handed out lunches at designated sites throughout the township. As of August, we have delivered over 100,000 meals to our District 205 students! We are extremely proud of our administrators, security, and kitchen workers as they have all certainly met the needs of our community day after day. In meeting those needs, we have partnered with Harvey, South Holland, Thornton Township, and the state to ensure our students have meals everyday! On those days, from 11:00am-12:30pm, you will receive enough food until the next pick-up day. We here at District 205 will continue to put the needs of our students and community first in everything we do!

To see all of our meal pick-up locations visit our website here:

The Thornwood High School marching band represented District 205 well by placing 2nd in “The Battle of the Bands,” at the 22nd Annual Chicago Football Classic on Saturday, September 14, at Soldier Field.

The Classic is not just another football game between two rivals. It was started in 1997 with the intent to generate resources to help fund HBCU scholarships for area students. For the last 20 years, it has ensured that African-American youth and their families experience an aspect of the HBCU experience which includes the game and “Battle of the Bands.”

This is just another instance of the excellence of District 205 bands. Our bands have consistently received high marks at various events and competitions near and abroad. This year’s 2nd place finish comes after placing 6th last year at this event.

We are so proud of Thornwood and look forward to raising the bar of expectations for our T-Birds!

Congratulations to our students and Thornwood Band Director, Mr. Dwayne Sanders on this impressive accomplishment!

Parkland survivor urges Thornwood students to be voice for change on gun violence

Standing Thursday before a room full of students at Thornwood High School, Mei-Ling Ho-Shing asks how many of them have been impacted by gun violence, and several of them raised their hands.

Ho-Shing spent the day at the South Holland school, visiting classrooms, talking about her experience and fielding questions from students, telling them they need to be vocal about gun violence and be a force for change.
